card.name: A Display of My Dark Power

property.name: Rules
property.value: When you set this scheme in motion, until your next turn, whenever a player taps a land for mana, that player adds one mana to his or her mana pool of any type that land produced.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: "What would you say is my greatest attribute? Is it my gluttonous lust for power?"

property.name: Rules
property.value: When you set this scheme in motion, take an extra turn after this one. Schemes can't be set in motion that turn.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: "Take a moment. Ponder the depths of your insignificance."

card.name: All Shall Smolder in My Wake

property.name: Rules
property.value: When you set this scheme in motion, destroy up to one target artifact, up to one target enchantment, and up to one target nonbasic land.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: "It's my goal to find the melting point of every substance."

property.name: Rules
property.value: When you set this scheme in motion, until your next turn, if a source would deal damage, it deals double that damage instead.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: "It's a dragon-infested lavascape of notorious peril. Make yourselves at home."

property.name: Rules
property.value: When you set this scheme in motion, destroy all nonland permanents target opponent controls.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: "I'd call that a successful first test. Golem! Rearm the Doom Citadel!"

property.name: Rules
property.value: When you set this scheme in motion, target opponent chooses a player. Until your next turn, only you and the chosen player can cast spells and attack with creatures.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: "It seems the fate of the world rests on your shoulders, feeble child."

property.name: Rules
property.value: When you set this scheme in motion, each opponent reveals cards from the top of his or her library until he or she reveals a creature card. Choose one of the revealed creature cards and put it onto the battlefield under your control. Put all other cards revealed this way into their owners' graveyards.

property.name: Rules
property.value: When you set this scheme in motion, each player shuffles his or her hand and graveyard into his or her library. You draw seven cards, then each other player draws four cards.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: "My vision is for the good of everyone. Mostly me."

property.name: Rules
property.value: When you set this scheme in motion, each opponent reveals his or her hand. Choose a nonland card from each of those hands. Those players discard those cards.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: "Oh, I think I will get away with this."

property.name: Rules
property.value: When you set this scheme in motion, you may pay X. If you do, put each nonland permanent target player controls with converted mana cost X or less on the bottom of its owner's library.

property.name: Rules
property.value: When you set this scheme in motion, put seven 0/1 green Plant creature tokens onto the battlefield. If you control ten or more lands, put seven 3/3 green Elemental creature tokens onto the battlefield instead.

property.name: Rules
property.value: When you set this scheme in motion, target opponent chooses self or others. If that player chooses self, he or she sacrifices two creatures. If the player chooses others, each of your other opponents sacrifices a creature.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: "Even you have a purpose. Your blood will oil the gears."

card.name: I Bask in Your Silent Awe

property.name: Rules
property.value: (An ongoing scheme remains face up until it's abandoned.) Each opponent can't cast more than one spell each turn. At the beginning of your upkeep, if no opponent cast a spell since your last turn ended, abandon this scheme.

card.name: I Call on the Ancient Magics

property.name: Rules
property.value: When you set this scheme in motion, each other player searches his or her library for a card, reveals it, and puts it into his or her hand. Then you search your library for two cards and put them into your hand. Each player shuffles his or her library.

property.name: Rules
property.value: When you set this scheme in motion, each opponent loses 3 life. You gain life equal to the life lost this way.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: "I can't imagine what you're feeling right now, but I'll try my best."

card.name: I Know All, I See All

property.name: Rules
property.value: (An ongoing scheme remains face up until it's abandoned.) Untap all permanents you control during each opponent's untap step. At the beginning of each end step, if three or more cards were put into your graveyard this turn from anywhere, abandon this scheme.

property.name: Rules
property.value: When you set this scheme in motion, put a token onto the battlefield that's a copy of target permanent an opponent controls.

property.name: Rules
property.value: When you set this scheme in motion, exile up to one target creature with flying, up to one target creature without flying, and all cards from up to one target opponent's graveyard.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: "You may even see them again. Full digestion takes three hundred years."

property.name: Rules
property.value: When you set this scheme in motion, choose one — Search your library for a creature card, reveal it, put it into your hand, then shuffle your library; or you may put a creature card from your hand onto the battlefield.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: "Meet my newest minion. Come now, don't be shy—shake her pincer."

property.name: Rules
property.value: When you set this scheme in motion, it deals damage to each opponent equal to the number of cards in that player's hand.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: "Cranial explosions for everyone. Still planning to outthink my dragons?"

property.name: Rules
property.value: When you set this scheme in motion, put a 5/5 red Dragon creature token with flying onto the battlefield.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: "Today I take the reins of destiny itself. Today the Draconic Apocalypse is upon you."

property.name: Rules
property.value: When you set this scheme in motion, target opponent chooses self or others. If that player chooses self, he or she sacrifices two lands. If the player chooses others, each of your other opponents sacrifices a land.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: "This should halt the spread of your insolence."

property.name: Rules
property.value: When you set this scheme in motion, each opponent's life total becomes the lowest life total among your opponents.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: "I certainly would have accepted my offer of eternal life. But if you choose death instead, who am I to argue?"

property.name: Rules
property.value: When you set this scheme in motion, gain control of all nonland permanents your opponents control until end of turn. Untap those permanents. They gain haste until end of turn. Each of them attacks its owner this turn if able.

property.name: Rules
property.value: When you set this scheme in motion, you may pay X. If you do, you gain X life and draw X cards.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: "I can see . . . everything. The beginning and the end of time. The raw edges of reality. And now I see exactly how to kill you."

property.name: Rules
property.value: (An ongoing scheme remains face up until it's abandoned.) At the beginning of your end step, you may put target creature card from an opponent's graveyard onto the battlefield under your control. When a creature put onto the battlefield with this scheme dies, abandon this scheme.

property.name: Rules
property.value: When you set this scheme in motion, each opponent reveals his or her hand. You may choose a noncreature, nonland card revealed this way and cast it without paying its mana cost.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: "Indulge me. Just one spell. One potentially fatal spell gone horribly awry."

property.name: Rules
property.value: When you set this scheme in motion, target opponent chooses a creature you don't control and puts it on top of its owner's library, then repeats this process for an artifact, an enchantment, and a land. Then the owner of each permanent chosen this way shuffles his or her library.

property.name: Rules
property.value: (An ongoing scheme remains face up until it's abandoned.) Whenever a creature attacks and isn't blocked, if you're the defending player, put a 0/1 green Plant creature token onto the battlefield blocking that creature. When four or more creatures attack you, abandon this scheme at end of combat.

property.name: Rules
property.value: (An ongoing scheme remains face up until it's abandoned.) If a source an opponent controls would deal damage to you, prevent 1 of that damage. At the beginning of each end step, if you've been dealt 5 or more damage this turn, abandon this scheme.

property.name: Rules
property.value: When you set this scheme in motion, each opponent sacrifices a creature. Then each opponent who didn't sacrifice a creature discards two cards.

property.name: Rules
property.value: When you set this scheme in motion, search your library for up to two basic land cards, put them onto the battlefield tapped, then shuffle your library.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: "Look around you. All you behold is mine to rule. It's the natural way."

property.name: Rules
property.value: When you set this scheme in motion, put five 1/1 green Saproling creature tokens onto the battlefield.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: "I assure you, these are not the kind that thrive on sunlight and water."

property.name: Rules
property.value: When you set this scheme in motion, for each opponent, put a 2/2 black Zombie creature token onto the battlefield that attacks that player each combat if able.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: "Don't come back until you've got brains in your teeth."

property.name: Rules
property.value: When you set this scheme in motion, target opponent chooses self or others. If that player chooses self, he or she discards four cards. If the player chooses others, each of your other opponents discards two cards.

property.name: Rules
property.value: When you set this scheme in motion, for each opponent, put up to one target creature card from that player's graveyard onto the battlefield under your control. Each of those creatures attacks its owner each combat if able.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: "Tell your old master I said hello."

property.name: Rules
property.value: When you set this scheme in motion, target opponent chooses self or others. If that player chooses self, this scheme deals 6 damage to him or her. If the player chooses others, this scheme deals 3 damage to each of your other opponents.

property.name: Rules
property.value: When you set this scheme in motion, put a 4/6 colorless Golem artifact creature token onto the battlefield.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: "It would be disappointing if you were unable to overcome this simplest of defenses. Hilarious, but disappointing."

property.name: Rules
property.value: When you set this scheme in motion, draw two cards. Artifact spells you cast this turn cost 2 less to cast.

property.name: Rules
property.value: (An ongoing scheme remains face up until it's abandoned.) Creatures you control get +2/+2 and have trample. When a creature you control dies, abandon this scheme.

property.name: Rules
property.value: When you set this scheme in motion, destroy up to three target nonland permanents.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: "Silence your wailing. This is but a taste of the destruction my pets have in store."

property.name: Rules
property.value: When you set this scheme in motion, you may pay X. If you do, this scheme deals X damage to target opponent and each creature he or she controls.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: "Let that be a lesson to you, your family, and everyone you've ever known."

property.name: Rules
property.value: When you set this scheme in motion, reveal the top three cards of your library. Put all land cards revealed this way onto the battlefield and the rest into your hand.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: "I can't abide laziness. Arise, forces of nature, and serve your master!"

property.name: Rules
property.value: When you set this scheme in motion, draw four cards. You have no maximum hand size until your next turn.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: "I have seen far beyond this imperfect world, into a tomorrow that doesn't include you."

card.name: Your Will Is Not Your Own

property.name: Rules
property.value: When you set this scheme in motion, gain control of target creature an opponent controls until end of turn. Untap that creature. It gets +3/+3 and gains trample and haste until end of turn.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: "Fool. I'll show you how to use that thing."

property.name: Rules
property.value: Artifacts you control have hexproof. (They can't be the targets of spells or abilities your opponents control.)

property.name: Flavor
property.value: Only leonin clerics who can survive the Razor Fields for one turning of the suns can stand in the Cave of Light.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: "By the time I got there, the heart had stopped. Fortunately, I was able to replace it with something better."

property.name: Rules
property.value: When Oblivion Ring enters the battlefield, exile another target nonland permanent. When Oblivion Ring leaves the battlefield, return the exiled card to the battlefield under its owner's control.

property.name: Rules
property.value: Exile target creature. Its controller may search his or her library for a basic land card, put that card onto the battlefield tapped, then shuffle his or her library.

property.name: Rules
property.value: Flying When Sanctum Gargoyle enters the battlefield, you may return target artifact card from your graveyard to your hand.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: As their supplies of etherium dwindled, mechanists sent gargoyles farther and farther afield in search of salvage.

property.name: Rules
property.value: Each noncreature artifact is an artifact creature with power and toughness each equal to its converted mana cost. (Equipment that's a creature can't equip a creature.)

property.name: Rules
property.value: ą, Ċ, Return an artifact you control to its owner's hand: You may put an artifact card from your hand onto the battlefield.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: "Wasted potential surrounds us. Lend me that bauble, and let me see what it can be made to be."

property.name: Rules
property.value: Put target creature on top of its owner's library, then fateseal 2. (To fateseal 2, look at the top two cards of an opponent's library, then put any number of them on the bottom of that player's library and the rest on top in any order.)

property.name: Rules
property.value: If there are ten or more creature cards total in all graveyards, Avatar of Woe costs 6 less to cast. Fear (This creature can't be blocked except by artifact creatures and/or black creatures.) Ċ: Destroy target creature. It can't be regenerated.

property.name: Rules
property.value: Put target artifact or creature card from a graveyard onto the battlefield under your control. Shuffle Beacon of Unrest into its owner's library.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: A vertical scream pierces the night air and echoes doom through the clouds.

property.name: Rules
property.value: Ć, Ċ, Discard a card: Add ĆĆĆ to your mana pool.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: The world is the body. The mana is the blood. The witch is the surgeon.

property.name: Rules
property.value: Other Zombie creatures you control get +1/+1. 2Ć, Ċ: Exile target creature card from a graveyard. Put a 2/2 black Zombie creature token onto the battlefield.

property.name: Rules
property.value: When Corpse Connoisseur enters the battlefield, you may search your library for a creature card and put that card into your graveyard. If you do, shuffle your library. Unearth only as a sorcery.)

property.name: Rules
property.value: Unearth Ć (Ć: Return this card from your graveyard to the battlefield. It gains haste. Exile it at the beginning of the next end step or if it would leave the battlefield. Unearth only as a sorcery.)

property.name: Flavor
property.value: The undead of Grixis are fueled by their hatred of the living.

property.name: Rules
property.value: Flying Whenever another creature leaves the battlefield, you may have target player put the top two cards of his or her library into his or her graveyard. Unearth 2Ć (2Ć: Return this card from your graveyard to the battlefield. It gains haste. Exile it at the beginning of the next end step or if it would leave the battlefield. Unearth only as a sorcery.)

property.name: Rules
property.value: When Festering Goblin dies, target creature gets -1/-1 until end of turn.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: In life, it was a fetid, disease-ridden thing. In death, not much changed.

property.name: Rules
property.value: Put a -1/-1 counter on target creature, two -1/-1 counters on another target creature, and three -1/-1 counters on a third target creature.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: Shadowmoor's main crops are rot, slime, and despair.

property.name: Rules
property.value: Whenever Infectious Horror attacks, each opponent loses 2 life.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: Not once in the history of Grixis has anyone died of old age.

property.name: Rules
property.value: All creatures get -2/-2 until end of turn.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: "This is why we don't go out in banewasp weather."—Rannon, Vithian holdout

property.name: Rules
property.value: Return target creature card from your graveyard to the battlefield with a mannequin counter on it. For as long as that creature has a mannequin counter on it, it has "When this creature becomes the target of a spell or ability, sacrifice it."

property.name: Flavor
property.value: "This vulgar mimicry will end now."—Desmera, perfect of Wren's Run

property.name: Rules
property.value: Put target creature card from a graveyard onto the battlefield under your control. You lose life equal to its converted mana cost.

property.name: Rules
property.value: 1Ć: Return Reassembling Skeleton from your graveyard to the battlefield tapped.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: Though you may see the same bones, you'll never see the same skeleton twice.

property.name: Rules
property.value: Trample Whenever Scion of Darkness deals combat damage to a player, you may put target creature card from that player's graveyard onto the battlefield under your control. Cycling 3 (3, Discard this card: Draw a card.)

Evoke 1Ć (You may cast this spell for its evoke cost. If you do, it's sacrificed when it enters the battlefield.)

property.name: Rules
property.value: Target player draws two cards and loses 2 life.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: "You know I accept only one currency here, and yet you have sought me out. Why now do you hesitate?"—Xathrid demon

property.name: Rules
property.value: Ć: Regenerate Twisted Abomination. Swampcycling 2 (2, Discard this card: Search your library for a Swamp card, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Then shuffle your library.)

property.name: Rules
property.value: 2Ć, Ċ, Discard a card: Each other player loses 2 life. You gain life equal to the life lost this way.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: "I have become a gourmet of sorts. Each soul has its own distinctive flavor. The art is in inviting the right company to the feast."

property.name: Rules
property.value: Discard two cards: Put a 2/2 black Zombie creature token onto the battlefield.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: The nomads' funeral pyres are more practical than ceremonial.

property.name: Rules
property.value: Return target creature card from your graveyard to the battlefield.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: "The first birth celebrates life. The second birth mocks it."—Mystic elder

property.name: Rules
property.value: First strike Morph 1ćć (You may cast this face down as a 2/2 creature for 3. Turn it face up any time for its morph cost.)

property.name: Flavor
property.value: Their skeletons can be found all over Skirk Ridge, tangled in each other's horns.

property.name: Rules
property.value: Kicker 2 (You may pay an additional 2 as you cast this spell.) Breath of Darigaaz deals 1 damage to each creature without flying and each player. If Breath of Darigaaz was kicked, it deals 4 damage to each creature without flying and each player instead.

property.name: Rules
property.value: Chandra's Outrage deals 4 damage to target creature and 2 damage to that creature's controller.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: "Her mind is an incredible mix of emotion and power. Even if I could grasp it, I couldn't hold it for long."—Jace Beleren, on Chandra Nalaar

property.name: Rules
property.value: Enchant creature Enchanted creature has haste. ć: Enchanted creature gets +1/+0 until end of turn. When a creature with converted mana cost 6 or greater enters the battlefield, you may return Dragon Breath from your graveyard to the battlefield attached to that creature.

property.name: Rules
property.value: Put two 1/1 red Goblin creature tokens onto the battlefield.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: Goblins journey to the sacrificial peaks in pairs so that the rare survivor might be able to relate the details of the other's grisly demise.

property.name: Rules
property.value: Flying ć: Dragon Whelp gets +1/+0 until end of turn. If this ability has been activated four or more times this turn, sacrifice Dragon Whelp at the beginning of the next end step.

property.name: Rules
property.value: Dragon spells you cast cost 2 less to cast.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: "We speak the dragons' language of flame and rage. They speak our language of fury and honor. Together we shall weave a tale of destruction without equal."

property.name: Rules
property.value: Fireball deals X damage divided evenly, rounded down, among any number of target creatures and/or players. Fireball costs 1 more to cast for each target beyond the first.

property.name: Rules
property.value: Flying Whenever Flameblast Dragon attacks, you may pay Xć. If you do, Flameblast Dragon deals X damage to target creature or player.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: Dragon lords of Jund rule by edicts of flame.

property.name: Rules
property.value: Flying ć: Furnace Whelp gets +1/+0 until end of turn.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: Baby dragons can't figure out humans—if they didn't want to be killed, why were they made of meat and treasure?

property.name: Rules
property.value: Hellbent — Gathan Raiders gets +2/+2 as long as you have no cards in hand. Morph—Discard a card. (You may cast this face down as a 2/2 creature for 3. Turn it face up any time for its morph cost.)

property.value: If you've been dealt damage by two or more creatures this turn, you may pay ć rather than pay Inferno Trap's mana cost. Inferno Trap deals 4 damage to target creature.

property.value: Add ććććć to your mana pool.

property.value: Vulshok mana rituals echo the day when the red sun burst through Mirrodin's surface to take its place in the heavens.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: The power of a waterfall. The fury of an avalanche. The intellect of a gale-force wind.

property.value: Volcanic Fallout can't be countered. Volcanic Fallout deals 2 damage to each creature and each player.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: "How can we outrun the sky?"—Hadran, sunseeder of Naya

property.name: Flavor
property.value: It shreds its prey as each head fights for the choicest bits.

property.value: Fertilid enters the battlefield with two +1/+1 counters on it. 1Ĉ, Remove a +1/+1 counter from Fertilid: Target player searches his or her library for a basic land card and puts it onto the battlefield tapped. Then that player shuffles his or her library.

property.name: Rules
property.value: Prevent all combat damage that would be dealt this turn.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: "I fear no army or beast, but only the morning fog. Our assault can survive everything else."—Lord Hilneth

property.name: Rules
property.value: Whenever a player casts a spell, you may put a +1/+1 counter on Forgotten Ancient. At the beginning of your upkeep, you may move any number of +1/+1 counters from Forgotten Ancient onto other creatures.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: Its blood is life. Its body is growth.

property.name: Rules
property.value: Destroy target artifact or enchantment. Conspire (As you cast this spell, you may tap two untapped creatures you control that share a color with it. When you do, copy it and you may choose a new target for the copy.)

property.name: Flavor
property.value: "Words lie. People lie. The land tells the truth."

property.name: Rules
property.value: Echo 2Ĉ (At the beginning of your upkeep, if this came under your control since the beginning of your last upkeep, sacrifice it unless you pay its echo cost.) When Hunting Moa enters the battlefield or dies, put a +1/+1 counter on target creature.

property.value: Ĉ: Target land becomes a 1/1 creature until end of turn. It's still a land. 2ĈĈĈ: Creatures you control get +3/+3 and gain trample until end of turn.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: "My mind has changed. My strength has not."

property.name: Flavor
property.value: Eidren, perfect of Lys Alana, ordered hundreds of trees uprooted and rearranged into a pattern he deemed beautiful. Thus the Gilt-Leaf Wood was born.

property.name: Rules
property.value: Trample (If this creature would assign enough damage to its blockers to destroy them, you may have it assign the rest of its damage to defending player or planeswalker.) Molimo, Maro-Sorcerer's power and toughness are each equal to the number of lands you control.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: "My mind is the spread of the canopy. My heart is the embrace of the roots. I am deathless Llanowar, its fury and its peace."

property.name: Flavor
property.value: "You are the grandest of all," said the archdruid to the trees. They became so proud of bark and branch that they suffered no creature to fly overhead or perch upon a bough.

property.name: Rules
property.value: Choose two — Target player gains 7 life; or put target noncreature permanent on top of its owner's library; or target player shuffles his or her graveyard into his or her library; or search your library for a creature card, reveal it, put it into your hand, then shuffle your library.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: Slain orochi warriors were buried with a tree sapling so they would become a part of the forest after death.

property.value: Built with neither a way to steer nor a way to stop, the juggernauts were simply aimed at an enemy's best defenses and told to charge.
